Immigration Law|Federal.title: Federal Immigration Program Updates Express Entry Selection Criteria
Immigration Law|Federal.summary: The Federal immigration department has announced changes to the Express Entry selection process, introducing category-based draws for in-demand occupations including healthcare workers, STEM professionals, and French language proficiency candidates.
key_changes: Lower CRS score requirements for healthcare workers
Enhanced points for French language proficiency
Faster processing times for priority occupations

Immigration Law|Federal.title: New Federal Provincial Nominee Program Stream for International Graduates
Immigration Law|Federal.summary: Federal has launched a new immigration stream specifically designed for international graduates from designated learning institutions, offering expedited pathways to permanent residence without requiring prior work experience.
key_changes: No work experience requirement for eligible graduates
Expanded list of eligible programs and institutions

Immigration Law|Federal.title: Federal Court Clarifies Humanitarian and Compassionate Grounds Assessment
Immigration Law|Federal.summary: In a landmark decision, the Federal Court has provided guidance on the assessment of humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) applications, emphasizing the importance of considering all relevant factors including establishment in Canada, best interests of children, and hardship factors.
Immigration Law|Federal.citation: Singh v. Canada (Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship), 2024 FC 123

Immigration Law|Federal.title: Federal Reduces Immigration Application Processing Times
Immigration Law|Federal.summary: Following technological improvements and increased staffing, Federal has significantly reduced processing times for permanent residence applications across multiple streams, with some applications now processed in under 6 months.

Immigration Law|Federal.title: Immigration Application Fees Adjusted for 2024
Immigration Law|Federal.summary: The government has announced updates to immigration application fees, effective immediately, reflecting administrative costs and service improvements while maintaining accessibility for applicants.
